alert.note: Alert for Chilton; Coosa; Shelby; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 8:39AM CDT until June 15 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: .Heavy rainfall this morning is creating ponding of water on area roads. Use caution while driving and avoid any flooded roadways. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Chilton, Coosa, Shelby and Talladega. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 837 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Alabaster, Pelham, Helena, Calera, Montevallo, Columbiana, Wilsonville, Talladega Springs, Weogufka, Shelby County Airport, Lay Lake, American Village, University Of Montevallo, Maylene, Marble Valley, Fayetteville, Strickland Crossroads, Unity, Shelby and Highway 145 and CR 46.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
